Body:
benison

c.1300, "blessing, beatitude," from O.Fr. beneiçon "blessing, benediction," from L. benedictionem (see benediction).

Similarly, the word malison comes in the exact way described above.

In other words, is it a regular sound change? Such as a sound law?
Title: How does the sound change from L. "benedictionem" to O.Fr. "beneiçon" happen?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
